intro: Majana forskalaei, commonly known as the mountain majana, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands or on rocky outcrops. Due to its unique habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
